definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: Chapter IV, The Criminal Subjective of Unjustifiable Self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 第四章防衛過當的主觀罪過形式。

sentences.english: Chapter II, Concept and nature of Unjustifiable Self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 文章主要對防衛過當的概念和本質進行了探討。

sentences.english: The first part, an overview of over-defense.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，防衛過當概述。

sentences.english: It is very important and necessary to study the circumstance of the subjective crime of excessive defense.
sentences.chinese: 研究防衛過當的主觀罪過形式實屬重要。

sentences.english: And further analysis of the over-defense conviction and sentencing should grasp the elements.
sentences.chinese: 並進一步分析了對防衛過當定罪量刑應當把握的要素。

sentences.english: The third part, the criminal responsibility of over-defense.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，防衛過當的刑事責任。
